answers.answer: This is not a significant enlargement and would be considered to be essentially normal by most experts.

question: I am a 22 year old male have upper and lower gastric problems and severe insulin resistance but no diabetes yet and am Obese. I have gained a lot of weight since sixteen years of age...due to the insulin resistance I guess..around when I was seventeen to eighteen I started getting a high TSH like highest was 6.85 ..but always normal t3 and t4 levels and normal thyroid peroxidase and thyroglobin antibodies...I was put on various..levels of synthroid took that for about two and a half years and TSH was normalized but never low than 3.10...I had my first ultrasound in nov 2011 which revealed multiple subcentimeter  thyroid nodules up to 0.5 mm in size...after that I was put off the synthroid and my TSH has been testing normal ever since...fast forward had another ultrasound nov 2013 which revealed no nodules no cysts or growths but enlarged left and right thyroid lobes.. This year I have gained and lost the same twenty pounds due to a gastric condition but other than that it has always been impossible for me to loose weight.THYORID ULTRASOUND NOV, 2011RIGHT LOBE: 5.5 X 1.4 X 1.7 CM.LEFT LOBE:  4.6 X 1.4 X 1.9 CM.THYROID ISTHMUS: 2mmFINDINGS: There are multiple subcentimeter nodules upto 5mm in size, right more than left.IMPRESSION: Bilateral subcentimeter nodules...CURRENT THYROID LEVELS:TSH: 2.61 mIU/mlFreeT4: 1.6 ng/dlTHYROID ULTRASOUND NOV 2013Findings; THE RIGHT LOBE IS ENLARGED AT : 4.5 X 1.3 X 2.1 CMTHE LEFT LOBE IS ENLARGED AT: 4.2  X 1.1 X 1.5 CMTHE ISTHMUS MEASURES: 4mmThe Thyroid gland demonstrates no evidence of solid or cystic mass or lesion. No mass effect on the airway.The surrounding musculature, soft tissues and visualized bilateral carotid vessels appear symmetrical. No hypervascularization is identified.I have a large round fatty neck with pressure in the throat area and face appears bloated and chubby.
title: DOES MY ENLARGED THYROID REQUIRE SYNTHROID....
